programme.title: CNN Newsroom
programme.desc: CNN Newroom provides the most up to date news as it breaks and is the longest running show on the channel, airing twice a day Monday to Friday and throughout the day over the weekends. CNN has developed a lot since its founding in 1980 by American media proprietor Ted Turner as a 24 hour cable news channel. As an organisation, CNN have won multiple awards, including a network-record six news and documentary Emmy Awards in 2018.

programme.title: CNN Newsroom
programme.desc: CNN Newroom provides the most up to date news as it breaks and is the longest running show on the channel, airing twice a day Monday to Friday and throughout the day over the weekends. CNN has developed a lot since its founding in 1980 by American media proprietor Ted Turner as a 24 hour cable news channel. As an organisation, CNN have won multiple awards, including a network-record six news and documentary Emmy Awards in 2018.

programme.title: World Sport
programme.desc: One of the CNNs longest running programmes that allows viewers to find out all the global sports news, see all the important events and most interesting parts, and enjoy the interviews with sports pundits and various sports stars.

programme.title: Connecting Africa
programme.desc: The African continent is going through a big transformation and this CNN magazine presents the entrepreneurs, companies and projects that are working hard to modernise it and make its economic integration possible. Hosted by Eleni Giokos, the episodes bring stories about the fast growing industry, network communication, cross-border trade and increasing trading routes, air connectivity, logistics infrastructure, small businesses and more.

programme.title: U.S. State of the Union Address
programme.desc: The Speech is addressed to the Congress and the American people. It aims to highlight administration work and its victories, target political enemies and demonstrate the Presidents vision for the whole country.

programme.title: Early Start
programme.desc: Start your day with all the information you need. This hour gives you the stories that will shape the next 24. On the agenda: U.S. politics and global affairs, what to expect in the business world, and key cultural and sporting events.

programme.desc: The latest news and information from around the world. Don Lemon, Poppy Harlow, and Kaitlan Collins host.

programme.title: Connect the World
programme.desc: Join high profile news anchor Becky Anderson live from Abu Dhabi as she brings you all the latest news from around the world . programme.title: What We Know with Max Foster

programme.title: Quest Means Business
programme.desc: Hes not messing around: Richard Quest presents his hot takes on the biggest breaking stories in the world of business. Watch for the expert analysis, commentary and opinions on the important headlines in the field from the notorious English journalist and CNN anchor. Joined by a cast of experts and correspondents delivering unrivaled facts and news, but also features and fascinating takes, figures and analysis on everything going down in the world of business.

programme.title: Connecting Africa
programme.desc: The African continent is going through a big transformation and this CNN magazine presents the entrepreneurs, companies and projects that are working hard to modernise it and make its economic integration possible. Hosted by Eleni Giokos, the episodes bring stories about the fast growing industry, network communication, cross-border trade and increasing trading routes, air connectivity, logistics infrastructure, small businesses and more.

programme.title: The Lead with Jake Tapper
programme.desc: News, politics and current affairs programme hosted by the award-winning, American journalist and author, Jake Tapper. Jake Tapper is the chief Washington correspondent for CNN and he will share his knowledge and insight into politics as well as covering a variety of other topics. This programme discusses a range of stories from topical events including national news, economics/finance, sports, health, technology and world affairs. The Lead with Jake Tapper has won a number of awards and accolades including three National Headliner Awards. Outside his work on television, Tapper has written for The New Yorker, The Washington Post and the Los Angeles Times as well as publishing his first novel, a political thriller.

programme.title: World Sport
programme.desc: One of the CNNs longest running programmes that allows viewers to find out all the global sports news, see all the important events and most interesting parts, and enjoy the interviews with sports pundits and various sports stars.

programme.title: The Brief with Jim Sciutto
programme.desc: The best CNN reporting from correspondents across the world, to guide global audiences through the fast-paced news cycle with insight and analysis.

programme.title: Erin Burnett OutFront
programme.desc: Hosted by Erin Burnett, an expert in political science and economics, OutFront is an hour-long news programme examining the latest stories from the US and further afield. Broadcast live from either the New York studio or live on location from the site of a breaking story, the show features insightful opinions from informed guests. With expert analysis from CNNs correspondents and analysis from the shows panel, Erin Burnett OutFront dissects the stories of the day, leaving no stone unturned. Burnett, a former financial analyst for Goldman Sachs, uses her forthright approach to engage interviewees in honest discussion.

programme.title: Anderson Cooper
programme.desc: Anderson Cooper delves into the days news, looking beyond the broadcast to give his take, prompting us to re-think what we hear in the headlines. Cooper has covered major, international stories like the aftermath of Hurricane Katrina on the Gulf Coast, the catastrophic BP oil spill and the 2010 earthquake in Haiti, which saw the whole world fall silent. The show has won an absolute plethora of awards over the years, including GLAAD Media and Emmy awards.

programme.title: The Source with Kaitlan Collins
programme.desc: Kaitlan Collins goes straight to the source for the best reporting on the days biggest stories.

programme.title: NASAs Unexplained Files
programme.desc: What do we really know about life beyond the realm of our planet? Disturbing discoveries about the rest of our universe have perplexed scientists, and the rest of the world, for as long as we can remember. Now, the files and discoveries of one of the worlds biggest independent agencies have been dug up, for thorough investigation. Each episode scrutinises questionable evidence, encounters and sightings, to shed some light on the unexplained files of NASA. Featuring testimonies of NASA insiders and scientists who have first hand experience of the enigmas, laying within our universe.

programme.title: Border Control Sweden
programme.desc: Alex receives a tip about a man acting suspiciously at Arlanda. Mimmi and Olivia gets a live surprise when opening a foul-smelling bag.

programme.title: Border Control: Spain
programme.desc: Going through customs can be a stressful experience for most people, even more so if youre attempting to smuggle drugs or weapons into the country. Follow the efforts of the Security and Customs Services at the border of Spain, as they work hard to keep their country safe from criminals. Whether its drugs, weapons or even terrorism, theres a lot of things security have to consider in order to make sure all threats are handled properly. These security forces are always hot on the trail of suspicious activity, in the air, on land or away at sea.

programme.title: Gold Rush
programme.desc: Gold Rush is a reality television series that follows the placer gold mining efforts of various family-run mining companies in boundless north of America. The series focuses on the work process in the conditions of permafrost and working relations between the participants. The show has 10 seasons altogether. In some episodes participants start the adventure and travel to Alaska to search for gold because of financial issues. They do not have any previous experience and have to learn on the job. Then there appears several gold mining teams that compete with each other. In some episodes the teams move to South America. Admire the courage and determination of the team members in their unstoppable desire to become rich.

programme.title: Gold Rush

programme.title: Truth Behind the Moon Landing
programme.desc: The USSR, may have been the first to put Yuri Gagarin into space, but did the Americans really land on the Moon in 1969? Its authenticity has become something of a conspiracy and mystery, for all those concerned, From Apollo scientists trying to validate the space expedition, to investigators evaluating the footage and claiming that it has been glamorised, by the effects of Hollywood. We scrutinise every element and aspect of lunar landers, astronaut movement and the controversy surrounding lost tapes, so you can make your own conclusive judgements. Using the expertise of many, we dissect popular theories as to whether humankind, is really possible of making it to the moon. It may well be: "one small step for man, one giant leap for mankind", but we will wait and see.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Meet modern-day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard. With demanding customers, high turnover, and one of the biggest decorative salvage yards in the UK, Drew is constantly on the road, crisscrossing the country in search of derelict gems and forgotten remnants. Drew loves the thrill of the hunt and while he gets his hands dirty in the countrys architectural backwaters, his team of restorers is back at the shop giving old and rare finds a new lease on life!

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Meet modern-day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard. With demanding customers, high turnover, and one of the biggest decorative salvage yards in the UK, Drew is constantly on the road, crisscrossing the country in search of derelict gems and forgotten remnants. Drew loves the thrill of the hunt and while he gets his hands dirty in the countrys architectural backwaters, his team of restorers is back at the shop giving old and rare finds a new lease on life!

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Buy, repair and restore and then resell a classic car in order to make profit- this is what Wheeler Dealers is about. The budget is limited, though you can see some exclusive and rare cars. Mike Brewer, a British dealer chooses the car carefully and hands it over to the mechanic, first Edd China, later Ant Anstead to be fixed and upgraded. The hosts are real masters of their trade, it seems they can bring life even to a piece of metal. It does not matter if you are a life-long car enthusiast or do not even have a driving license you will admire the results of hard work from the beginning to the end of the long uneasy restoring process.

programme.title: Motor Mythbusters
programme.desc: Inspired by a mobster movie, the team want to see if they can bombproof a 1981 Cadillac Eldorado. And, they test out three myths on electric cars.

programme.title: How Its Made
programme.desc: Have you ever wondered how things that surround us every day are produced? Find out about the whole process from the beginning to the end in a documentary television series How Its Made. The series demonstrates how various items like clothing and accessories, food, industrial products, cars, musical instruments and many more are manufactured. Who would have thought how exciting it would be to watch a cupcake, formula 1 race car or gummy vitamins being made?

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: As the modern world becomes progressively automated and mechanised its easy to become detached from how things are made and how they work. The hit series returns to uncover the miraculous feats of engineering which underpin life in the 21st century. How the seemingly mundane are often the result of highly sophisticated engineering and production processes. This fascinating behind-the-scenes journey delves deep into the production of everyday modern items from surfboards to satchels and trombones to cricket bats.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Meet modern-day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard. With demanding customers, high turnover, and one of the biggest decorative salvage yards in the UK, Drew is constantly on the road, crisscrossing the country in search of derelict gems and forgotten remnants. Drew loves the thrill of the hunt and while he gets his hands dirty in the countrys architectural backwaters, his team of restorers is back at the shop giving old and rare finds a new lease on life!

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: Expert craftsmen are bringing Drew Pritchards finds back to life and restore them to their former glory. Drew hunts for treasures such as derelict gems and forgotten remnants across the country. And then he and his team do the restoration turning trash to gold, so that worn objects become shining gems for which Drews customers want to pay a lot of money. All kinds of items can and will be restored, starting from a century-old suitcase to an ancient coffee machine, from a ravaged carousel horse to a large railway clock.

programme.title: Cheap Old Houses
programme.desc: Cheap Old Houses is inspired by Ethan and Elizabeth Finkelsteins uber popular Instagram feed by the same name, which racks up millions of views with images of surprising property bargains that are architecturally intact and available for under $150,000. In each episode, cameras will follow the couple as they tour low-priced older houses across America and ultimately choose which ones to feature on their famous site.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: A documentary chronicling real life the adventures of one of the most deadliest professions in the world. Follow Alaskan crab fishermen as they face 40-foot waves and intense discomfort with freezing temperatures as they fish in the Bering sea. Sacrificing tooth and nail to catch the seasonal delicacies to later sell and trade on land. Witness the dangers these fisher men face as they battle against the sea, and experience how caution is a crucial part of staying alive.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch

programme.title: Survival instinct
programme.desc: Discovery Channel takes the ubiquitous survival show theme to the next level by stripping it to its bare essentials. Two complete strangers -- a man and a woman -- meet in a very unique way: Theyre stranded in a dangerous, desolate location, without food and water, and theyre completely naked. Each episode follows the two as they attempt to survive on their own for 21 days, with nothing but one personal item each and the knowledge that the only prize is their pride and sense of accomplishment. Because there is no other choice, the couple quickly get to know each other -- and their surroundings -- and hope that their instincts, survival skills and intestinal fortitude will serve them well.

programme.title: Fast n Loud
programme.desc: Fast N Loud is a reality styled TV show featuring Richard Rawlings and his crew from the Dallas, Texas-based Gas Monkey Garage. For most people old rusty cars in garages or open spaces are nothing but junk, but not for these guys. For them it is a perfect chance to reconstruct such vehicles and make some money. The old run-down cars are restored flawlessly and are able to run steadily for the next 10 years for sure. Richard and his crew work really hard to make a name for themselves and have become a huge success thanks to their enormous talents.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How Do They Do It? Ever wondered how the stripes get into toothpaste or how contact lenses are made? How do goods get from one country to another and then into our supermarkets? What are car tires made from and exactly why are plasma TV screens flat? Eating, drinking, driving, flying. These all are activities that we carry out with barely a second thought. But have you ever wondered what exactly goes into your teabag and how it got there? How does an airport handle hundreds of thousands of items of luggage each day? And just how can a cars airbag inflate so quickly? Every day – often without even realizing it – we come into contact with technology, be it in the bathroom, in the car or on the golf course. We take a look at how things work, and focus on some of the most amazing examples of everyday objects including the worlds fastest elevator and the most expensive chocolate money can buy.

programme.title: How Its Made
programme.desc: Have you ever wondered how things that surround us every day are produced? Find out about the whole process from the beginning to the end in a documentary television series How Its Made. The series demonstrates how various items like clothing and accessories, food, industrial products, cars, musical instruments and many more are manufactured. Who would have thought how exciting it would be to watch a cupcake, formula 1 race car or gummy vitamins being made?

programme.title: Bitchin Rides
programme.desc: Bitchin Rides is a reality styled TV show hosted by Dave Kindig from the Salt Lake City, Utah-based company Kindig It Designs. Daves real passion is designing and building custom cars. We watch the process of restoring and rebuilding all types and all periods of cars. In each episode Dave and his team review a car, create a design, then the team takes it apart and rebuilds to create a one-of-a-kind gem. Things get really ugly before they get pretty. Dave has the best team of top mechanics, technicians and fabricators in the business, quality is their only focus when they create the baddest bitchin rides.

programme.title: Ed Staffords Rite Of Passage
programme.desc: In Brazil, Ed endures the painful bullet-ant ceremony. Also facing 24 hours of agony are the Brazilian boys who do this 20 times to become men.

programme.title: Dual Survival
programme.desc: Survival experts Cody and Dave head to the Valley of the Volcanoes to take on the survival scenario: a broken-down car, in the middle of a barren land, with few survival resources.

programme.title: Darkness
programme.desc: Taking survival series to new depths, literally, Darkness sends willing survivalists into caves, underground networks, and abandoned mines to see how long they can cope with the physical and mental toll of living without light. Based on the sensory-deprivation training regimes employed both NASA and the military, these enduring escapades will push the participants to their edge of their limits, forcing them to work as a team and utilise their individual skill sets. Each of the shows participants is given custom equipment that will document their adventures without inducing light.

programme.title: Alaska: The Last Frontier
programme.desc: American reality series is about Alaskan pioneers Yule and Ruth Kilcher and their kids living together at their homestead. The Kilchers demonstrate one-of-a-kind model of surviving in severe conditions of the last frontier. Enjoy amazing panorama views of Alaska, showing its various nature. Sitting in a comfortable chair in your warm apartment just try to imagine how it really is when electricity and running water is not inevitable fact of life. The Kilchers hunt, go fishing, garden, gather, raise livestock in order to survive Alaskas uncontrollable power and wilderness.

programme.title: Salvage Dawgs
programme.desc: Mike Whiteside and Robert Kulp are the hosts of Salvage Dawgs show that is about saving beautiful old things from buildings planned to be torn down. They and their talented crew teach the viewers how to repurpose old stuff into something new and useful instead of throwing it away. So if you are remodeling your home think twice before you get rid of anything. Get creative, have some fun and learn tips and tricks to help you build your skills. Learn how to transform old chairs into a functional bench, how to repurpose an old paneled door into a shelf and enjoy fantastic vintage pieces from the past.

programme.title: Overhaulin
programme.desc: Overhaulin is an American reality TV series about customizing cars. The main difference from the other shows of this type is detailed presentation of the technical process and import scene plus serious-minded approach to the car owners needs. The hosts are Chip Foose and Chris Jacobs. The concept of the series is that the car owner is absolutely unaware of whats going on. His car disappears one day and the owner is convinced that it has been stolen, misplaced or lost at a mechanics shop, or has been towed away by police. Chip Foose and a team of mechanics have a week to remake the car into a custom masterpiece. Each show ends up with the surprise reuniting of the owner and his customized baby on four wheels.

programme.title: Amazing Water Homes
programme.desc: Captivating docu-reality series in which Rebecca Budig shows viewers some of the worlds most amazing, luxurious and extraordinary water featured homes. You will have a chance to see what happens when you combine creativity, ingenuity and lots and lots of water when she takes us on a tour of cool properties such as a private water parks, islands and lakes, luxury houseboats and yachts with every amenity imaginable including a private crew.

programme.title: The Last Alaskans
programme.desc: The Last Alaskans chronicles the daily rituals of four families choosing to live in seclusion, vast distances from each other as they overcome harsh arctic conditions, frustrating setbacks, and aggressive wildlife while they survive in one of the last great unspoiled and unforgiving wildernesses on the planet. In the refuge, prop planes, canoes and dog sleds replace the modern luxuries that most people take for granted. Humans cohabit with the animal world and often share the same emotions and struggles while they discover that they are not necessary at the top of the food chain. Utilizing an authentic and organic approach to document the weeks leading up to and during the winter season, The Last Alaskans sets a distinctive and vibrant tone unlike any other docu-series before to completely immerse the viewer into a world that would otherwise be lost in history.

programme.title: The Last Woodsmen
programme.desc: Jared counts on a new driver to boost production at the Forever Claim and keep John Mohammeds hands off Float Camp.

programme.title: Gold Rush: Parkers Trail
programme.desc: Following on from his earlier adventures prospecting for gold in the contiguous 48 states, Gold Rush: Parkers Trail focuses on the further exploits of presenter Parker Schnabel as he attempts to make new discoveries in other areas. With his companion, Rick Ness, Schnabel endeavours to travel the deadly Klondike Trail over the Chilkoot Pass and up the Yukon River to Dawson City tracing the steps of the 1897 Gold Rush prospectors. Other series take Schnabel on a hiking and mining undertaking in Guyana; to Papua New Guinea where they sail, fly, hike and drive to reach their destination; and to Australia, the island nation that experienced several gold rushes from 1851 onwards.

So if you are remodeling your home think twice before you get rid of anything. Get creative, have some fun and learn tips and tricks to help you build your skills. Learn how to transform old chairs into a functional bench, how to repurpose an old paneled door into a shelf and enjoy fantastic vintage pieces from the past.

programme.title: Overhaulin
programme.desc: Overhaulin is an American reality TV series about customizing cars. The main difference from the other shows of this type is detailed presentation of the technical process and import scene plus serious-minded approach to the car owners needs. The hosts are Chip Foose and Chris Jacobs. The concept of the series is that the car owner is absolutely unaware of whats going on. His car disappears one day and the owner is convinced that it has been stolen, misplaced or lost at a mechanics shop, or has been towed away by police. Chip Foose and a team of mechanics have a week to remake the car into a custom masterpiece. Each show ends up with the surprise reuniting of the owner and his customized baby on four wheels.

programme.title: Gold Rush
programme.desc: Gold Rush is a reality television series that follows the placer gold mining efforts of various family-run mining companies in boundless north of America. The series focuses on the work process in the conditions of permafrost and working relations between the participants. The show has 10 seasons altogether. In some episodes participants start the adventure and travel to Alaska to search for gold because of financial issues. They do not have any previous experience and have to learn on the job. Then there appears several gold mining teams that compete with each other. In some episodes the teams move to South America. Admire the courage and determination of the team members in their unstoppable desire to become rich.

programme.title: The Last Woodsmen
programme.desc: Jared counts on a new driver to boost production at the Forever Claim and keep John Mohammeds hands off Float Camp.

programme.title: Dream Journey
programme.desc: February 2017 saw me embark upon a travel expedition through Scotland, Poland, France, Mexico, Belize and, (alas!), back. Not only was it the first time I ventured out to Central America, but also the first time I seriously pushed my bravery boundaries to do a whole lot of things Id never tried before. I defeated my life-long fear of scubadiving and skydiving, (the Carribbean vistas do help! - No danger Id do that again in Aberdeen), I went zip-lining over a Mexican jungle, I tried habanero-packed streetfood, (failed at that miserably), and organic tequila, (managed that better;), I climbed a Maya pyramid in the middle of a Belizean rainforest and fed hibiscus flowers to a very extravagant donkey. Most importantly, however, I got to know some incredible people - from shamans, wanderers and artists to refugees, businesswomen and expat cowboys. And thanks to aaaall of that, I also got to know a little bit more about myself for visiting the most remote corners of our planet reminds you how different and yet how similar we all are. Im looking forward to sharing my incredible experience in 5 exciting episodes of our travel series, which really turned out to be a Dream Journey:) I simply cannot wait for more!

programme.title: European Islands
programme.desc: Tenerife is the largest and most diverse of the seven Canary Island. It is home to Spains highest mountain - Pico del Teide with an elevation of nearly 4OOO meters. Tenerife includes an incredible ten defined climate zones!!! There are substantial differences between the north and the south of the island. The northern, windward side receives three fourths of all precipitation, which is why it is green year round. The significant differences in elevation also contribute to the great contrasts, as do the mountain ranges extending through the middle of the island. You can experience large differences in temperature on Tenerife, especially in the winter months- you can swim and sunbathe on the southern beaches, while its freezing and snowing on the summit of Teide.

programme.title: New Frontier
programme.desc: Series introduction and the study of Earth from orbit. The sky above is littered with stars and countless galaxies. It is where we come from and where we are destined to return. The first phase of this journey is complete, now commences the second, with robotics, advanced technologies and sheer daring we are now going where before we only dreamt.

programme.title: New Frontier
programme.desc: The Moon, our closest celestial companion. Our indispensible dance partner through the cosmos. Lighting our night sky and gently tugging at our shores. Few have walked on her surface, though her allure remains strong, once again we are glancing her way with renewed interest and with a view to return very soon.

programme.title: Inside Outer Space
programme.desc: Come with us as we explore and unravel the mysteries of what lies beyond our planet Earth. This is a series packed with space stories and information about our universe covering what we can see, how we can live in space and what science tells us about the past and the future as we journey inside out of space.

programme.desc: Come with us as we explore and unravel the mysteries of what lies beyond our planet Earth. This is a series packed with space stories and information about our universe covering what we can see, how we can live in space and what science tells us about the past and the future as we journey inside out of space.

programme.title: Wow, I Never Knew That!
programme.desc: It was the PURRRFECT idea for making our furry friends more pleasant around the house! Youll learn how KITTY LITTER clawed its way into our homes. And youll learn how a garment made out of special woven fibers can stop a bullet, plus, why is walking under a ladder bad luck? And finally, well CUT TO THE CHASE and explain the history behind this common phrase!

programme.title: Wow, I Never Knew That!
programme.desc: Its been sweetening America for almost 40 years! Now, find out the truth behind how SWEET N LOW actually got its name! And why do we yell SHOTGUN when getting into a car with friends? Then, is it really bad luck to open an umbrella in the house? And, learn the salty truth on how the POTATO CHIP was invented out of ANGER!

programme.title: Big Coast
programme.desc: Running Southbound outside on Central Coast with a big Tyee Chinook Release finish North of Milbanke Sound!

programme.title: Big Coast
programme.desc: Chasing big Chinook Salmon just outside Rivers Inlet, BC from Duncanby Lodge!

programme.title: China Uncovered
programme.desc: From the skyscrapers of Shanghai to the mountainous peaks of "The Last Shangri-La", explore the breathtaking landscape of this incredible country and connect with the people that infuse Chinas everyday life with flavor, passion and prosperity. Through the eyes of a cultural academic, a laborer, an architect, an urban planner, and a photographer, the grand evolution of a little fishing village is illustrated and documented to reveal one of the fastest growing megacities in the world. And while the physical landscape gracefully moves towards the future, beliefs, behaviors, and practices are put into test. The changes brought by the Thirty Year Miracle are indeed immense, and it has left no stone, no life, unturned.

programme.title: Music Voyager
programme.desc: Music Voyager is a music and travel broadcast series (television/cable, broadband, in-flight and mobile) that invites viewers to discover the exciting sounds of the planet. The host is Jacob Edgar, an explorer who does not search for lost cities or ancient ruins. Hes on the quest for a different kind of treasure…music. As an ethnomusicologist and world music record producer, Edgar travels the globe hunting for the best songs the world has to offer, and he suffers through some of the worst…so you dont have to. Along the way, hes rewarded with a backstage pass to concert halls, street festivals, recording studios and rehearsal rooms. With local musicians as his guide, Edgar tastes exotic and occasionally ghastly food, visits off-the-beaten path attractions and parties the night away to amazing concerts at hidden venues that only the locals know. Join music voyager for unexpected adventures and surprising discoveries that unveil the magic, mystery and music of far off lands.

Files features a group of paranormal investigators, who use intuitive abilities and a deep knowledge of metaphysical techniques to interact with the entities they encounter at haunted locations. They encourage the spirits to share their stories in their own words through amazing EVPs and other evidence that is bridging the gap between the worlds of science and spirituality.

programme.title: Past Hunters
programme.desc: The Hack Green Secret Nuclear Bunker is a former government-owned nuclear bunker located at Hack Green, Cheshire, England. It Started as a decoy site for enemy bombers but later developed into a legitimate base. Now it is ripe with hauntings.

programme.title: Past Hunters
programme.desc: What stories lay buried beneath the surface, waiting to be revealed? 200 years on from Raffles landing, archaeologists are digging deep and unearthing new artefacts that reshape what we think we know about Singapore. From uncovering evidence of an ancient settlement, to discovering forgotten relics from the lives of people in colonial Singapore and World War 2, they are piecing together new evidence that will paint a story of Singapore over seven centuries. In this three-episode series, teams of archaeologists will look to the land and seas for clues to seek out these lost chapters of history that are forgotten by time, only to be uncovered today.

programme.title: What In the World
programme.desc: Presented by Peadar King, this series illustrates the human consequences of global economic inequalities and human rights violations, by focusing on how people encounter these issues on a daily basis. At the heart of Africa, the Congo for many people will always be associated with Joseph Conrads early twentieth-century novel the Heart of Darkness, a title that has become a by-word for the country. And for Benjamin and David, two former child soldiers, and Funaha held as a sex slave by one of the many militias that continue to terrorise the country, that metaphor remains a daily reality. The film explores how this seemingly never-ending conflict impacts on the people of North Kivu.

programme.title: Travel Thru History
programme.desc: We head underground and visit the Hidee Gold Mine to see how this most precious material is obtained. Then we get a tour of the brand new History Colorado Center where well explore Colorados past through first hand stories and interactive attractions.

programme.title: Travel Thru History
programme.desc: Marvel at the site of Americas most famous water dam. Well learn about how the Hoover Dam was built, why its necessary, and take a behind the scenes look at its inner workings.

programme.title: Natures Force
programme.desc: What is La Nina and how is it being monitored? Find out the effects and the reach that this system is influencing. How did Indian Summer get its name and what is the science behind the phenomenon? Winter is the season that has the biggest effect on the planet, animal behaviour and often brings out the worst that nature can bring. Natures Halo is a magical sight with a scientific explanation. The story of and lessons from Hurricane Katrina give us a great understanding of the ferocity and speed that nature can unleash.

programme.title: Natures Force
programme.desc: Weather is universal and its also Extra Terrestrial. Learn about space weather and how it can impact us on earth. Supercells are unique storms that scientists have learnt to measure into three types. Under the earths crust, nature is extremely energetic, and we see this through the Volcano which acts as our eye into the forces beneath our feet. Learn about the purple buzzing glow called St Elmos Fire, how it was named and were to look for it.

programme.title: Animal Embassy
programme.desc: For over a year, the staff at Loro Parque have been patiently waiting for a huge event to take place. Morgan, the deaf orca is about to give birth to her very first calf. The stakes are high, and the staff are holding their collective breath as the scene is set for the greatest natural phenomenon in the zoos history.

programme.title: Animal Embassy
programme.desc: As Loro Parques head vet, Jorge never knows from one day to the next what will come through his clinic. From tending to oversexed otters, fine-footed flamingoes or armoured armadillos, a day spent with Jorge, is a day immersed in nature from the four corners of the globe. Ever seen a grown man hug a turtle? For Javier, Loro Parques Head of Environmental Affairs, its all part of the job! Hes hitting the high seas of Tenerife with a turtle tracker in hand to help with scientific research - but first hes just got to locate the turtle - 2,000 meters down in the ocean!

programme.title: Sarah Shark
programme.desc: Sarah travels to one of the top 10 dive destinations in Australia (Julian Rocks, Byron Bay, NSW) to dive with three species of Wobbegong Sharks within the Cape Byron Marine Park. She also conducts a street poll with members of the public to find out what they think about sharks.

programme.title: Meet My Wild Friend
programme.desc: Gasp at animal power, gawp at childhood innocence, this is the true story of children who live as friends with wild animals. The director of The First Cry, Gilles de Maistre has traveled the world in search of children who maintain unusual and special relationships with wild animals. With the strength of innocence, the power of raw faith and the magic of respect, these little princes have found the balance between two worlds in harmony with one another, where child and animal trust each other, learn to know one another, live together and love each other. Gasp at animal power, gawp at childhood innocence, this is the true story of children who live as friends with wild animals.

programme.title: Show Me Where You Live
programme.desc: Show me where you live is a documentary series that aims to answer the following question: How can human beings claim ownership to a space so that they can live safely within it, function as a society, and above all be in harmony with the environment around them? As we discover cultures and emblematic populations, we follow Philippe Simay who is at the heart of Inhabiting the World and represents its identity and originality. Philippe takes us on an epic adventure around the Human Habitat and sets the tone for the journey. As a humanist and philosopher, Philippe is a tireless surveyor of the city, and an explorer of living spaces. Determined to travel around the world, Philippe unveils how the populations that he encounters claim the space they occupy, shapes it and adjust to it. In this series of 20 films, of 26 minutes each, the habitat will be a major showcase revealing our capacity to adapt ourselves at a time where we need to find solutions in order to address immense changes.

programme.title: Journeys in Africa

programme.desc: They manage to fly over the first hills of the Chilean mountain range, but fail and fall in a small town and must be rescued. Next to the pilot Cristian Millas we will fly in the Chilean precordillera, aboard a modern hot air balloon.

programme.title: European Islands
programme.desc: The European islands are renowned primarily for their hotel resorts. However, we will show you a completely different face of theirs: forests, beaches, coves, mountains, valleys and rivers. Perhaps you will find places that will take your breath away. Why just lie on the beach when there is so much to see? Put on some good hiking shoes, pull your shoelaces tight, and get to know the entire island like the back of your hand.

programme.title: European Islands
programme.desc: Rhodes is located in the Mediterranean Sea, in a place where the Mediterranean and the Aegean Sea meet. This is one of the reasons that its eastern and western coasts are so very different from one another. Its no coincidence that its called the island of the god Helios - it has the most sunny days out of all the Greek islands - a whole 3OO sunny days a year. Rhodes is not just beaches - its a crossroads of cultures with a history going back 2400 years.

programme.title: Blue World
programme.desc: Learn all there is to know about the deep blue sea with dynamic naturalist and underwater photographer Jonathan Bird. Co-produced by Jonathan Bird Productions and the non-profit organisation Oceanic Research Group, this show provides a fun and engaging learning platform, educating the viewers about all things underwater, including animal stories, marine research, recent discoveries and stunning underwater photography. A true family favourite, Jonathan Birds Big Blue World is easily enjoyed by viewers of all ages, whether theyre 6 or 76!

programme.title: Water: H2O Stories
programme.desc: Water: H2O Stories is a 3x52 series revisiting the story of water on planet Earth and its disrupted course over time which has led to the 21st century biggest challenge.

programme.title: Wonder
programme.desc: Seg 1 Carrion flowers. Carrion flowers are the unorthodox perception of flowers for they are rare, big, and very unpleasant. Other terms are stink flowers and corpse flowers. The biggest flower in the world, rafflesia arnoldii, is a carrion flower. These flowers are difficult to find and reproduce and could breed through cross-pollination by attracting flies and dung beetles. Seg 2 Aposematism. Aposematism is a form of signalling that enables protection for both preys and predators by giving signs of poison and danger through showing off the bright colors and patterns on their epidermal layers that become associated with inedibility. Some species have developed mimicry based on aposematism in order to avail the protection aposematic colors give. Seg 3 Cuckoo Misdirection. Cuckoo misdirection demonstrates the mimicking abilities of a female cuckoo in order to find host nests to hatch her eggs. The female mimics a cry of a predator bird in order to frighten the hosts, leaving them vulnerable, thus the cuckoo can seize the chance to drop her egg on a host nest. Seg 4 Pheromones. Animal pheromones are the chemicals secreted and released by different species to communicate with other organisms. There are various types serving different purposes, ranging from reproduction, to trailing, to alarms. Some pheromones are also specific to one species of animals. Seg 5 Deimatic Behavior. Deimatic behavior is another type of defensive behavior in animals that also involves mimicry. Its the opposite of aposematism because while aposematism works by blatantly showing or signalling its danger or unpalatability, deimatic behavior relies on the element of surprise to startle predators in order for species to flee to safety.

programme.title: Wonder
programme.desc: Saccadic Eye Masking. Saccadic eye movements are characterized as the fast movement of eyes when perceiving motion. These are so fast that they are blurred. To compensate for the blurriness, our brains mask these blurred visions to help us see a completed albeit masked version of sight. Seg 2 Plant Movement. While plants do not exhibit movement for locomotion or moving from place to place, they still exhibit movement in response to different stimuli. These movements are plant adaptations for food production, plant reproduction and survival. Seg 3 The Language of Color. Language plays a major role in how people from different parts of the world perceive color. The fact that some languages completely lack terms for some colors that other languages have come to know offers insight on how much influence it has on the way people see colors. Seg 4 Color Blindness. Color blindness is the condition that makes people not able to properly see and perceive colors. Color blindness is the result of damaged or underdeveloped rods and cones. these are the light sensitive cells that can be found in the part of our eyes known as the retina which are responsible for seeing colors. Color blindness can either be genetic or caused by sustained damage to the retina over time. Seg 5 Perspective Illusion. This is a technique used in illustrations to render scenes and objects in 3 dimensions with depth and foreshortening. The technique was pioneered by Italian painters during the renaissance period. It involves drawing objects with reference to points measured from a constant line of sight.

programme.title: Quirky Science
programme.desc: In contrast with popular belief, Edison did not invent the light bulb. Many people contributed to the invention. Mind you, the first lamp was invented around 70,000 BC. Once upon a time we had limelight, which was actually quite unsafe, and then there were arc "arc lamps" - shedding light that blinded movie stars up to the point where they had to wear sunglasses. What Edison did was improve the light bulb to become a practical, affordable and safe product. He tested over 5000 filaments to make the bulb last: from bamboo fiber to a hair out of an assistants beard. At the same time others were working on light bulbs made with gasses, which we now know as energy efficient lamps. Modern-day lighting innovations are quite startling, a lot of them - we cant even see with the naked eye… Lasers, for example. For the longest time it was merely a pet-theory of the grand Einstein. Nobody knew what to make of this idea that "atoms could release their excess energy as light" When the laser was invented, people joked that the laser was a solution looking for a problem. Now it is omnipresent. In the near future: laser-light therapy by flashing the human brain.

programme.title: Quirky Science
programme.desc: A man with an ear for music, one of the first to try teaching the deaf how to speak, thought he could build a "harmonic telegraph". He had this idea that several notes could travel through a wire simultaneously, instead of the one Morse code that the telegraph could transmit. He thought this to be possible because he misinterpreted the writings of a researcher writing in German - a language he did not know. - And would later describe his misinterpretation as a "very valuable blunder". The man was Alexander Graham Bell and he invented telephony. The big question is: what happens in that wire? How can voices travel? Bell and his assistant eventually proved that different tones would vary the strength of an electric current in a wire. In fact, its the vibrations of the voice that determine the strength of the current. His invention caused a lot of fuss - yet it took years before people comprehended the scale of it: before the widespread use of the phone - whom were you going to call? Eventually, the telephone, or better said, its wiring, leads to the Internet. Nowadays we mostly make our calls "wireless" so the wire Graham Bell used to make voices travel over long distances is no longer needed How does that work? Even wireless calling, some say, is actually a very unnatural way of communicating. Looking at the future, are we heading towards a "phoneless" call?

programme.title: Zenith - Advances In Space Exploration
programme.desc: A revolution in space technology is unfolding. New players in the launch industry are radically cutting the cost of access to space and understanding of the universe is growing exponentially thanks to space-based research.

It is the only other place in our solar system than Man might one day call home.

Now within our grasp these rocks of ice and dust are ready to give up their secrets.

programme.title: Wow, I Never Knew That!
programme.desc: Its been sweetening America for almost 40 years! Now, find out the truth behind how SWEET N LOW actually got its name! And why do we yell SHOTGUN when getting into a car with friends? Then, is it really bad luck to open an umbrella in the house? And, learn the salty truth on how the POTATO CHIP was invented out of ANGER!

programme.title: Wow, I Never Knew That!
programme.desc: Learn the secrets behind THERMOS amazing technology! And they were the sweet candy pellets we loved as a kid, but did you know that PEZ was created to help people stop smoking? And find out how a steamboat inspired SAMUEL LANGHORNE CLEMENS to change his name to MARK TWAIN!

programme.title: Music Voyager
programme.desc: Music Voyager is a music and travel broadcast series (television/cable, broadband, in-flight and mobile) that invites viewers to discover the exciting sounds of the planet. The host is Jacob Edgar, an explorer who does not search for lost cities or ancient ruins. Hes on the quest for a different kind of treasure…music. As an ethnomusicologist and world music record producer, Edgar travels the globe hunting for the best songs the world has to offer, and he suffers through some of the worst…so you dont have to. Along the way, hes rewarded with a backstage pass to concert halls, street festivals, recording studios and rehearsal rooms. With local musicians as his guide, Edgar tastes exotic and occasionally ghastly food, visits off-the-beaten path attractions and parties the night away to amazing concerts at hidden venues that only the locals know. Join music voyager for unexpected adventures and surprising discoveries that unveil the magic, mystery and music of far off lands.

programme.title: Rip Files
programme.desc: The R.I.P. Files features a group of paranormal investigators, who use intuitive abilities and a deep knowledge of metaphysical techniques to interact with the entities they encounter at haunted locations. They encourage the spirits to share their stories in their own words through amazing EVPs and other evidence that is bridging the gap between the worlds of science and spirituality.

programme.title: Rip Files
programme.desc: The R.I.P. Files features a group of paranormal investigators, who use intuitive abilities and a deep knowledge of metaphysical techniques to interact with the entities they encounter at haunted locations. They encourage the spirits to share their stories in their own words through amazing EVPs and other evidence that is bridging the gap between the worlds of science and spirituality.

programme.title: Past Hunters
programme.desc: The Drakelow Tunnels are a former underground military complexused mainly for storage. However, during the construction and running of this facility, 6 people are thought to have died. It is believed most of the hauntings that occur here are from the very people that died here.

programme.title: Past Hunters
programme.desc: Blackpool Pleasure Beach is one of the most visited attractions in the United Kingdom. People visit it not only for the fun, but to also hopefully catch a glimpse of the many ghosts that haunt there.

programme.title: What In the World
programme.desc: Presented by Peadar King, this series illustrates the human consequences of global economic inequalities and human rights violations, by focusing on how people encounter these issues on a daily basis. At the heart of Africa, the Congo for many people will always be associated with Joseph Conrads early twentieth-century novel the Heart of Darkness, a title that has become a by-word for the country. And for Benjamin and David, two former child soldiers, and Funaha held as a sex slave by one of the many militias that continue to terrorise the country, that metaphor remains a daily reality. The film explores how this seemingly never-ending conflict impacts on the people of North Kivu.

programme.title: What In the World
programme.desc: Presented by Peadar King, this series illustrates the human consequences of global economic inequalities and human rights violations, by focusing on how people encounter these issues on a daily basis. programme.title: Travel Thru History
programme.desc: Marvel at the site of Americas most famous water dam. Well learn about how the Hoover Dam was built, why its necessary, and take a behind the scenes look at its inner workings.

programme.title: Travel Thru History
programme.desc: The city of brotherly love does not disappoint history lovers. We visit Independence hall, the liberty bell, Elfreths alley, the Philadelphia Museum of Art, and get creeped out at Americas first penitentiary, Eastern State.

programme.title: Natures Force
programme.desc: Weather is universal and its also Extra Terrestrial. Learn about space weather and how it can impact us on earth. Supercells are unique storms that scientists have learnt to measure into three types. Under the earths crust, nature is extremely energetic, and we see this through the Volcano which acts as our eye into the forces beneath our feet. Learn about the purple buzzing glow called St Elmos Fire, how it was named and were to look for it.

programme.title: Natures Force
programme.desc: The beauty, magic, and the science behind the Auroras at both ends of the earth, show them to be more than just a protective magnetic layer. The technology used to measure Wind Speed is finely calibrated with an interesting formula. The Tides remind us of our connection to the moon and our place in the solar system and are monitored for any significant change can have implications for industry, communities, and our ocean life. Earthquakes often make news headlines so how are they measured and predicted and what can we learn from them about our planet? Acid Rain is a manufactured weather event, the result of manmade industry mixing with nature to result in international treaties to lessen emissions and pollution.

programme.title: Animal Embassy
programme.desc: As Loro Parques head vet, Jorge never knows from one day to the next what will come through his clinic. From tending to oversexed otters, fine-footed flamingoes or armoured armadillos, a day spent with Jorge, is a day immersed in nature from the four corners of the globe. Ever seen a grown man hug a turtle? For Javier, Loro Parques Head of Environmental Affairs, its all part of the job! Hes hitting the high seas of Tenerife with a turtle tracker in hand to help with scientific research - but first hes just got to locate the turtle - 2,000 meters down in the ocean!

programme.title: Animal Embassy
programme.desc: "Finding Nemo" may have brought fame to the striped clownfish but their newfound popularity has sent worldwide numbers into decline. Now we follow the aquarium team as they initiate their very own breeding program with the hope of finding many more Nemos to come. Jorge has got a 200-pound problem on his hands. Lin Mao the white tiger has something wrong with his hip and the vets need to make a diagnosis. Problem is, Lin Maos not responding to the anesthetic Jorge just administered and he has to decide what to do next...very quickly.

programme.title: Sarah Shark
programme.desc: Sarah travels to one of the top 10 dive destinations in Australia (Julian Rocks, Byron Bay, NSW) to dive with three species of Wobbegong Sharks within the Cape Byron Marine Park. She also conducts a street poll with members of the public to find out what they think about sharks.

programme.title: Meet My Wild Friend
programme.desc: Gasp at animal power, gawp at childhood innocence, this is the true story of children who live as friends with wild animals. The director of The First Cry, Gilles de Maistre has traveled the world in search of children who maintain unusual and special relationships with wild animals. With the strength of innocence, the power of raw faith and the magic of respect, these little princes have found the balance between two worlds in harmony with one another, where child and animal trust each other, learn to know one another, live together and love each other. Gasp at animal power, gawp at childhood innocence, this is the true story of children who live as friends with wild animals.

programme.title: Meet My Wild Friend

programme.title: Angelos Outdoor Kitchen
programme.desc: In this episode Wanaka based Chef Angelo Georgalli is in the South Island of New Zealand fishing for salmon in a glacier fed river on the south west coast, north of Fiordland. Using his rustic portable kitchen, he prepares pan fried salmon with tapenade and green beans, chunky salmon steaks with a roasted garden salad and finally salmon fajitas with a tropical mango salsa.

programme.title: Angelos Outdoor Kitchen
programme.desc: In this episode Wanaka based Chef Angelo Georgalli is in the North Island of New Zealand diving for mussels off the Matakana Coast. Using his rustic portable kitchen, he prepares mussels with a Neapolitan sauce, a mussel chowder with seaweed and his own fish stock and finally a Roman classic, mussel carbonara.

programme.title: Nomads
programme.desc: Follow breathtaking travel adventures of some well known athletes of extreme sports. Have a look at some stunning locations in Alaska, Mexico, Argentina, Japan, Tahiti, Africa, Costa Rica, Norway, Hawaii and whitewater kayaking, extreme big mountain skiing, windsurfing, kiteboarding, extreme snowboarding and big wave surfing that push the limits of possibility. The focus is on compelling personalities and great storytelling.

programme.title: Nomads
programme.desc: Follow breathtaking travel adventures of some well known athletes of extreme sports. Have a look at some stunning locations in Alaska, Mexico, Argentina, Japan, Tahiti, Africa, Costa Rica, Norway, Hawaii and whitewater kayaking, extreme big mountain skiing, windsurfing, kiteboarding, extreme snowboarding and big wave surfing that push the limits of possibility. The focus is on compelling personalities and great storytelling.

programme.title: Show Me Where You Live
programme.desc: Show me where you live is a documentary series that aims to answer the following question: How can human beings claim ownership to a space so that they can live safely within it, function as a society, and above all be in harmony with the environment around them? As we discover cultures and emblematic populations, we follow Philippe Simay who is at the heart of Inhabiting the World and represents its identity and originality. Philippe takes us on an epic adventure around the Human Habitat and sets the tone for the journey. As a humanist and philosopher, Philippe is a tireless surveyor of the city, and an explorer of living spaces. Determined to travel around the world, Philippe unveils how the populations that he encounters claim the space they occupy, shapes it and adjust to it. In this series of 20 films, of 26 minutes each, the habitat will be a major showcase revealing our capacity to adapt ourselves at a time where we need to find solutions in order to address immense changes.

programme.title: Show Me Where You Live

programme.title: Out Of Town Adventures
programme.desc: Outta Town Adventures travels both near and far to discover the best advenures the destinations have to offer. Season 1 visits attractions from California to Rwanda, Switzerland, Iceland, Utah, Zambia, Mexico, The Grand Canyon, Georgia (the Eastern European one) Louisiana, Hawaii, Mauritius and Seychelles. This TV series is dedicated to presenting history, culture and geography in a fun and pisitive way. It encourages people to explore this beautiful world - something that starts with simply getting out of town!

programme.title: Journeys in Africa
programme.desc: This ancient ruined city, lost to history, was one of the most powerful in the world during its prime. The architectural sophistication and sheer size will amaze. Then Journeys heads out to the deep ocean for some big game fishing. Will we land the big one or return empty handed?

programme.title: Journeys in Africa
programme.desc: Featured in films and documentaries, the mane-less lions of Tsavo have a fierce reputation - man-eaters. Journeys embarks on a photo hunt for these legendary beasts of the bush. In the process, we witness the raw power of the ghosts in the dark.

programme.title: Journeys in Africa
programme.desc: This is definitely the land of the elephant. Large herds of pachyderms roam this marshy park putting on a show for whoever wants to watch. But thats not the only big boys of this park—buffalo, lion and a host of hoofed game make this a wonder to behold.

programme.title: Journeys in India
programme.desc: Journeys in India is a ground-breaking travel series focusing on the Indian subcontinent. This first season highlights the history, culture, architecture, and wildlife of one of the most mysterious and exciting areas on earth. Perfect for the would-be or armchair traveler, this 13 part series is beautifully filmed with all original footage. Join host Bill Ball as he takes you on the adventures of a lifetime!

programme.title: Journeys in India
programme.desc: Journeys in India is a ground-breaking travel series focusing on the Indian subcontinent. This first season highlights the history, culture, architecture, and wildlife of one of the most mysterious and exciting areas on earth. Perfect for the would-be or armchair traveler, this 13 part series is beautifully filmed with all original footage. Join host Bill Ball as he takes you on the adventures of a lifetime!

programme.title: Dream Journey
programme.desc: February 2017 saw me embark upon a travel expedition through Scotland, Poland, France, Mexico, Belize and, (alas!), back. Not only was it the first time I ventured out to Central America, but also the first time I seriously pushed my bravery boundaries to do a whole lot of things Id never tried before. I defeated my life-long fear of scubadiving and skydiving, (the Carribbean vistas do help! - No danger Id do that again in Aberdeen), I went zip-lining over a Mexican jungle, I tried habanero-packed streetfood, (failed at that miserably), and organic tequila, (managed that better;), I climbed a Maya pyramid in the middle of a Belizean rainforest and fed hibiscus flowers to a very extravagant donkey. Most importantly, however, I got to know some incredible people - from shamans, wanderers and artists to refugees, businesswomen and expat cowboys. And thanks to aaaall of that, I also got to know a little bit more about myself for visiting the most remote corners of our planet reminds you how different and yet how similar we all are. Im looking forward to sharing my incredible experience in 5 exciting episodes of our travel series, which really turned out to be a Dream Journey:) I simply cannot wait for more!

programme.title: European Islands
programme.desc: The European islands are renowned primarily for their hotel resorts. However, we will show you a completely different face of theirs: forests, beaches, coves, mountains, valleys and rivers. Perhaps you will find places that will take your breath away. Why just lie on the beach when there is so much to see? Put on some good hiking shoes, pull your shoelaces tight, and get to know the entire island like the back of your hand.

programme.title: Blue World
programme.desc: Jonathan heads down to the shipwrecks of North Carolina (USA) to observe how these wrecks have become home to thousands of animals, including Sand Tiger sharks. But instead of chasing all the fish, the sharks are protecting many of them! Then, Jonathan visits the School for Field Studies in the Turks and Caicos Islands to learn how college students conduct fieldwork in their pursuit of degrees in Marine Studies. He helps tag sharks, study conch and investigate marine protected areas!

programme.title: Trouble in Lemur Land
programme.desc: High up in the mountains of north-eastern Madagascar lives one of the worlds most critically endangered primates. There are less than a thousand Silky Sifakas alive today and this area of remote rainforest, known as Marojejy-Anjanaharibe-Sud, is their only home.In the past, the rugged terrain here kept the Silkies relatively safe but things are now changing at an alarming pace. This magical place is under serious threat from illegal logging operations as international demand for highly sought-after rosewood and ebony increases. Unscrupulous logging gangs are encroaching on the Silkies last remaining habitat."Trouble in Lemur Land" follows two men, an American primatologist and a Malagasy conservationist, on their quest to protect this rare species, at the same time providing a rare glimpse into the life of this extraordinarily beautiful and graceful animal.The film centres around the arrival of two babies in the group - a glimmer of hope in an otherwise desperate situation. Lemur reproduction rates are slow and Silkies only mate one day in the year, so it is a very special moment when primatologist Erik Patel sees the newborns for the first time. He has a permanent camp on the outskirts of their last remaining territory and we are given a rare glimpse into this intimate, close-knit group as the babies develop in the sanctuary of the forest canopy.Meanwhile, taking advantage of long-term political instability, the loggers are steadily extracting Madagascars rosewood for export to China. Although they are well armed and highly motivated, conservationist Desire Rabary is not afraid to confront them, regardless of the risks. He heads up a network of local people who play a vital role in the survival of the forest and its lemurs. Over the past five years, he has worked hard to actively expose the loggers illegal trail of destruction but, as this film reveals, the heart of the problem starts on his own doorstep.This 50-minute HD film brings the forest to life, with stunning images of many of its other species, including the striking helmet vanga bird, white-fronted brown lemur, red-bellied lemur, green tree frogs, panther chameleons and the elusive fossa. This treasure trove of endemic Madagascan wildlife is a timely reminder of what we stand to lose if the environmental issues so critical to their survival are not urgently addressed.

programme.title: Fragrance and Emotions
programme.desc: Unique documentary that takes you to discover the secret of some of the most luxurious perfumes and emblematic fragrances in the world. Visit the famous city of Grasse to meet the creators, the beautiful flower fields and all the incredible emotional powers of the Perfume.

programme.title: Mbudha, in the Chimpanzees Footsteps
programme.desc: In the northeast corner of the Democratic Republic of the Congo, there remains a "red zone", designated as such since the second war of the Congo, (1998-2002), where no foreigners have entered since 1999. The biologist Anne Laudisoit and a Congolese scientists team embark upon a scientific exploration to identify species that dwell in one of the last virgin territories of Central Africa. In the lush yet inaccessible valleys of the Blue Mountains, an amazing startling bio-diversity thrives. It is said that there are even chimpanzees.

programme.title: Baccarat, the Crystal Legend
programme.desc: This film retraces 250 years of French art de vivre from Royal Courts to todays finest Crystal works found in the most prestigious settings commissioned by leading figures and celebrities. The saga started in Lorraine a region known for its tradition in glassmaking where the manufacture shaped its unrivaled know-how and created its iconic pieces. Today, to shape its brand into the XXIst century with intact splendor and craft, the worlds most celebrated crystal maker has developed fruitful collaboration with international designers, such as Philippe Starck.

programme.title: Croc Labyrinth
programme.desc: Herpetologist Vince Shacks and underwater cameraman Brad Bestelink go on a unique crocodile diving adventure to find out more about these cave systems, and how the reptiles use them. They enter a dark underworld of mystery and danger, and they find themselves doing things that no one has ever attempted before. Apart from swimming with huge crocodiles, theyre the first to noose a wild Nile crocodile underwater, and theyre the first to attach a remote camera to it, to see where it goes.

programme.title: Saving Auschwitz?
programme.desc: 70 years after Auschwitz Museum was founded as the memorial site of the Shoah, this site is subject to diversions, confrontations and plundering. Several attempts to exploit and rewrite its history are at work. The danger of desensitization through mass tourism, or the attempts of the local town and its citizens to simply erase the nightmare to make place for new urban landscape are real threats affecting the future of this memorial site. Today, as the last survivors are passing on, what to do with the Auschwitz site?

programme.title: Andalusia: The Moorish Architecture
programme.desc: Andalusia, the Spanish territory has a confluence of cultures which is represented in its architecture! Visigothic, Roman, Byzantine and Arab - the structures in the region display all these influences. Between 8th and 15th century, several dynasties from Arab to Berber conquered Andalusia impacting the way of life of people. The film tells this story through beautiful edifices of Andalusia.

programme.title: Vanity Fair: Konfidencionāli
programme.desc: Ņujorkas sabiedrisku dāmu terorizē sadistisks vajātājs, kurš draud nolaupīt viņas meitu. Kas viņš ir? Kāpēc viņš viņu spīdzina? Un cik tālu viņš ies?

programme.title: Noslepkavots no rīta
programme.desc: Draugi Ņūorleānā ierodas pilsētā, meklējot jautru uzdzīvi. Līdz saullēktam viens no viņiem tiek atrasts miris izdegušas automašīnas bagāžniekā. Aizdomās turēti tiek visi, taču tieši upura vārdi galu galā palīdz atrast slepkavu.

programme.title: Pazudis
programme.desc: Pēc izkāpšanas no skolēnu autobusa pazūd Ali Lovicers. Izmeklēšana uz diviem gadiem nonāk strupceļā, taču tad pienāk vēsts, ka Ali varētu būt nonācis cilvēku kontrabandistu nagos. SWAT komanda ielaužas prieka namā, bet vai tas ļaus 16 gadus veco Ali pārvest mājās?

programme.title: Pazudis
programme.desc: 13 gadus vecā Tabita Tudera Nešvilā pazūd ceļā uz autobusa pieturu. Policija uzskata, ka viņa aizbēgusi, bet pazušanu apvij trauksmainas likumsakarības, kuru dēļ meitenes ģimene izmisīgi meklē patiesību.

programme.title: Duo Mix
programme.desc: Nakts programma ar mūzikas video dažādām gaumēm. Dejojiet, dziediet līdzi vai izbaudiet, guļot zem segas.

programme.title: Pazudis
programme.desc: 13 gadus vecā Tabita Tudera Nešvilā pazūd ceļā uz autobusa pieturu. Policija uzskata, ka viņa aizbēgusi, bet pazušanu apvij trauksmainas likumsakarības, kuru dēļ meitenes ģimene izmisīgi meklē patiesību.

programme.title: Algota slepkavība
programme.desc: Nežēlīgs noziedznieks no krāpšanas pāriet uz slepkavību nozari, plānojot nežēlīgu atriebību tiesu sistēmai. Šis sižets aizskar detektīvus, kuri cenšas novērst sava drauga un kolēģa slepkavību.

programme.title: Sekss un slepkavības
programme.desc: Romantisks un ainavisks agra rīta brauciens ar laivu pārvēršas nāvējošā situācijā - Lerijs Izenbergs pārkrīt pāri bortam. Izmeklētāji atklāj pusmiljona dolāru pazušanu, kas varētu būt slepkavības motīvs.

programme.desc: Šerifa birojs DeRiderā, Luiziānā, saņem satraucošu telefona zvanu no Dee moteļa īpašnieka - vīrietis paziņo, ka sestajā numuriņā atradis mirušu sievieti.

programme.title: Pazudis
programme.desc: Otrkursnieks Martins Roberts ir populārs savā korporācijā, bet kādudien viņš pazūd. Vienīgais viņa atstātais pavediens - kodēta zīmīte. Atklājas dažnedažādākie noslēpumi. Paejot diviem gadiem, viņa ģimene turpina dzīvot neziņā par to, kas ar jaunieti noticis.

programme.title: Kriminālistika: īstais CSI
programme.desc: Vestmidlendas policija saņem trauksmes zvanu no Pablo Hoada, kas uzstāj, ka viņš nogalinājis savu draudzeni. Vēlāk viņš norāda, ka tā ir bijusi aizstāvēšanās pret uzbrukumu.

programme.title: Algota slepkavība
programme.desc: Liktenīgs noziegums paliek neatrisināts. Lieta nonāk strupceļā, līdz apņēmīgs detektīvs aizdomās sāk turēt algotu slepkavu. Policisti plāno slepenu operāciju, lai identificētu vainīgo, tomēr viņiem ir tikai viena iespēja viņu notvert.

programme.title: Sekss un slepkavības
programme.desc: 2018. gada 22. martā Springbrukā 24 gadus vecais Alekss Vudvorts Ezras Makkendlesa automašīnā tika 16 reizes brutāli sadurts galvā, kaklā, cirksnī un rumpī. Makkendlesam 2020. gadā par slepkavību tika piespriests mūža ieslodzījums.

programme.title: Slepkavība motelī
programme.desc: Gavilanas kalnos policijas darbinieki pamestas automašīnas bagāžniekā atrod divus līķus. Izmeklēšana viņus aizved uz viesnīcu "National Inn" Koronā.

programme.title: Noslepkavots no rīta
programme.desc: Nakts izklaide ar labiem draugiem izvēršas drūma - viens no viņiem pazūd. Dažas dienas vēlāk, kad tiek atrastas cilvēku mirstīgās atliekas, izmeklētāji saglabā vēsu prātu, cenšoties notvert slepkavu, pirms vēl viena nakts beigsies ar slepkavību.

programme.title: Pazudis
programme.desc: Otrkursnieks Martins Roberts ir populārs savā korporācijā, bet kādudien viņš pazūd. Vienīgais viņa atstātais pavediens - kodēta zīmīte. Atklājas dažnedažādākie noslēpumi. Paejot diviem gadiem, viņa ģimene turpina dzīvot neziņā par to, kas ar jaunieti noticis.

programme.title: Kriminālistika: īstais CSI
programme.desc: Vestmidlendas policija saņem trauksmes zvanu no Pablo Hoada, kas uzstāj, ka viņš nogalinājis savu draudzeni. Vēlāk viņš norāda, ka tā ir bijusi aizstāvēšanās pret uzbrukumu.

programme.title: Noslepkavots no rīta
programme.desc: Nakts izklaide ar labiem draugiem izvēršas drūma - viens no viņiem pazūd. Dažas dienas vēlāk, kad tiek atrastas cilvēku mirstīgās atliekas, izmeklētāji saglabā vēsu prātu, cenšoties notvert slepkavu, pirms vēl viena nakts beigsies ar slepkavību.

programme.title: Pazudis
programme.desc: Pazudis 70 gadus vecais atvaļinātais ugunsdzēsējs Maikls Čemberss. Asiņaina nozieguma aina viņa garāžā liecina par ko šausminošu, taču likumsargi ātri vien sāk izskatīt variantu, ka tas viss ir bijis iestudēts, un Maikls patiesībā pazudis apzināti.

programme.title: Kriminālistika: slepkavas noķeršana
programme.desc: Policijas rīcībā ir tikai skelets, lai palīdzētu izskaidrot to, kas notika ar ķermeni, kas tika atrasts 10 gadus pēc slepkavības.

programme.title: Algota slepkavība
programme.desc: Skatītāji tiek iepazīstināti ar Dalijas Dipolito - divdesmit sešus gadus vecās eskorta meitenes - tiesas prāvām, kuras kļuva par bēdīgi slaveno femme fatale un mediju sensāciju. Viņai tika izvirzītas apsūdzības par uzmākšanos sava vīra Maika slepkavībai.

programme.title: Sekss un slepkavības
programme.desc: Ikdienas pirkums varētu novest policiju pie Lauras Akersones - jaunas mātes, kuras ķermeņa daļas uzpeldēja aligatoru pilnā strautā teju 2000 kilometru attālumā no vietas, kur viņa pēdējo reizi redzēta - slepkavas.

programme.title: Slepkavība motelī
programme.desc: 2016. gada 5. janvāris, Baltimora, Merilenda. Policijas darbinieki reaģē uz ziņu par mirušu vīrieti, kas atrasts Deluxe Plaza motelī Baltimoras ziemeļaustrumos. Upuri - ASV Jūras spēku veterānu Edvardu Jesaitisu - atrada moteļa uzkopšanas komanda.

programme.title: Noslepkavots no rīta
programme.desc: Pēc ballītes māte atklāj ko neiedomājamu - pēkšņi tuvu draugu loks tiek turēts aizdomas par slepkavību. Izmeklētāji strādā ātri, mēģinot atklāt šo noslēpumu, bet, diemžēl, notiek vēl viens ļauns uzbrukums, kas gan var viņus novest līdz tās autoram.

programme.title: Kailā pievilcība
programme.desc: Savdabīgs randiņu šovs, kurā cilvēki līdz ar mīlas peripetijām iepazīstas ar pakāpeniski atkalinātiem ķermeņiem. Pēcāk jāizģērbjas arī viņiem pašiem un jāizvēlas.

programme.title: Kailā pievilcība
programme.desc: Savdabīgs randiņu šovs, kurā cilvēki līdz ar mīlas peripetijām iepazīstas ar pakāpeniski atkalinātiem ķermeņiem. Pēcāk jāizģērbjas arī viņiem pašiem un jāizvēlas.

programme.title: Ofiss
programme.desc: Ofisā, kura darbinieki nodarbojas ar papīra pārdošanu un piegādi, viss ir tāpat kā lielākajā daļā pasaules ofisu - tajā ir boss, tajā ir dažādi darbinieki, no kuriem dažs labs vien darbu tikai imitē, un starp visiem izveidojušās ofisa attiecības tādā kā piespiedu kārtā - labākas un arī ne tik labas. Kā jau ar kolēģiem. Ofisa vadītājs Maikls, kuru attēlo slavenais aktieris un komiķis Stīvs Karels, savus darbiniekus ik dienas cenšas iesaistīt savos izgudrotajos jokos un uzdevumos. Viņš pats domā, ka ir pasaules labākais boss, ko apliecina krūzīte ar uzrakstu - "Pasaules labākais boss". Diemžēl šo krūzīti viņš sev nopircis pats. Maikls cenšas būt draudzīgs pret saviem darbiniekiem, tomēr lielākā daļa viņa joku ir rasistiski, šovinistiski vai citādi aizskaroši.

programme.title: Visi mīl Reimondu
programme.desc: Reimonds ir vienkāršs Amerikas pilsonis, viņš strādā par sporta žurnālistu un kopā ar savu burvīgo ģimeni dzīvo Longailendā. Reimonds dzīvi neuztver pārāk nopietni, viņš ar jokiem mēģina iziet no jebkuras dzīves situāciju, un visas rūpes par trim bērniem un sadzīvi labprāt uztic sievai Debrai. Debrai šāds vecmodīgs ģimenes modelis nav īsti pa prātam, tomēr Rejs spītīgi dod priekšroku sporta pārraidēm, nevis sarunām par laulības problēmām. Iespējams, ģimene sadzīvotu tīri labi, tomēr viņiem ir kaudze radinieku, kuri regulāri iegriežas ciemos, un visiem ir nodoklis par notiekošo. Tas, protams, nozīmē garantētus strīdus, nesaprašanās, pārpratumus un arī jautrību!

programme.title: Divarpus vīri
programme.desc: Divi brāļi nevarētu būt dažādāk –: Čārlijam ir viss, ko dzīvē var vēlēties: nauda, skaista māja okeāna piekrastē, pavisam nedaudz darāmā un neskaitāmas draudzenes. Turpretī Alans ir īsts neveiksminieks – no viņa ir izšķīrusies sieva, kura ir paturējusi sev abu kopīgi iegādāto māju, un Alans nespēj savilkt kopā galus, lai samaksātu rēķinus. Tā kā Alanam nav pa kabatai atļauties savu mājokli, viņš lūdz Čārlijam atļauju padzīvot pie viņa kādu laiciņu, kamēr apradīs ar jauno situāciju un atradīs pats savu mājvietu. Viņi pat nenojauta, uz cik ilgu laiku tas ievilksies un cik daudz jautrības tas sagādās skatītājiem.

programme.title: Mani sauc Erls

programme.title: Mani sauc Erls
programme.desc: Erls ziedo lielus personīgus upurus, cenšoties palīdzēt Rendijam īstenot savu sapni doties uz karsējmeiteņu nometni. Džoja ir sarūgtināta, jo viņas dēlam Katalīna šķiet seksīgāka par viņu.

programme.title: Precējies... Ir bērni
programme.desc: Kellijai ir liels notikums, apmeklējot Lerija Storča aktiermeistarības skolu. Viņai un Lerijam Storčam jāuzstājas uz skatuves izrādes "Operas spoks" etīdē. Kad apavu veikala īpašnieks Gerijs nokautēs Leriju Storču, pret kuru viņam ir personīgs riebums, Alam būs jāatstāj pusnakts izpārdošana apavu veikalā, lai dotos palīgā Kellijai teātrī.

programme.title: Precējies... Ir bērni
programme.desc: Pegija tiek uzaicināta uz Bingo finālu. Par šausmām Als un Džefersons uzzina, ka viņu oficiālā kluba No Maam alus Girlie Girl Beer jaunais modelis ir Joko Ono. No Maam ir jāizvēlas jauns oficiālais alus.

programme.title: Mani sauc Erls
programme.desc: Erlam ir iespēja izsvītrot divas lietas no sava saraksta, sarīkojot Džojas zēniem Helovīna ballīti un iegūstot Rendijam "mazo brāli" — Katalīnas brāļadēlu. Abi plāni var izgāzties, jo visi domā, ka Katalīnas brāļadēls ir apsēsts.

Iespējams, ģimene sadzīvotu tīri labi, tomēr viņiem ir kaudze radinieku, kuri regulāri iegriežas ciemos, un visiem ir nodoklis par notiekošo. Tas, protams, nozīmē garantētus strīdus, nesaprašanās, pārpratumus un arī jautrību!

programme.title: Visi mīl Reimondu
programme.desc: Stundu ilgs atskats ar aktieru un producentu intervijām, spilgtākajiem mirkļiem un ieskatu pēdējā filmēšanas nedēļā.

programme.title: Ofiss
programme.desc: Ofisā, kura darbinieki nodarbojas ar papīra pārdošanu un piegādi, viss ir tāpat kā lielākajā daļā pasaules ofisu - tajā ir boss, tajā ir dažādi darbinieki, no kuriem dažs labs vien darbu tikai imitē, un starp visiem izveidojušās ofisa attiecības tādā kā piespiedu kārtā - labākas un arī ne tik labas. Kā jau ar kolēģiem. Ofisa vadītājs Maikls, kuru attēlo slavenais aktieris un komiķis Stīvs Karels, savus darbiniekus ik dienas cenšas iesaistīt savos izgudrotajos jokos un uzdevumos. Viņš pats domā, ka ir pasaules labākais boss, ko apliecina krūzīte ar uzrakstu - "Pasaules labākais boss". Diemžēl šo krūzīti viņš sev nopircis pats. Maikls cenšas būt draudzīgs pret saviem darbiniekiem, tomēr lielākā daļa viņa joku ir rasistiski, šovinistiski vai citādi aizskaroši.
